intro: Manulea hirta, commonly known as the hairy manulea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas under forest canopies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
